definition:
Let ${{\mathbb G}}_B$ and ${{\mathbb G}}_B$\* be two groupoids whose
object spaces are Borel. An *algebraic morphism* from ${{\mathbb G}}_B$
to ${{\mathbb G}}_B$\* is defined as a left action of ${{\mathbb G}}_B$
on ${{\mathbb G}}_B$\* which commutes with the multiplication on
${{\mathbb G}}_B$. Such an algebraic morphism between Borel groupoids is
said to be a *Borel morphism* if the action of ${{\mathbb G}}_B$ on
${{\mathbb G}}_B$\* is Borel (viz. ref. [@MRB2k6])

[9]{}

M.R. Buneci. 2006., , [*Surveys in Mathematics and its Applications*]{},
Volume 1: 71–98.
